channel.title: Data on Josiah King
channel.description: Recent content in Data on Josiah King

item.title: It's not *what you know*...
item.description: but how loud you shout about what you think. So much of the content found online about statistics seems to exude confidence and knowledge about complex methodologies. It almost seems like there is one group of people who are often over-confident, and (perhaps unintentionally) appear quite condescending in their explanations (see e.g., every stackoverflow answer ever), and another group who are perpetually terrified that they’re getting it wrong[^0 ].
